result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R. Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew R. Bauer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From Bookkeeping - Per request in 10/10/2016 letter - forwarded copy of payment summary to Def @ JESO
From the defendant regarding Court costs and a payment plan.

Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in custody.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
(TN) Cases 15CF243 & 15CM259 called at 2:08 pm 

Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Statements made by the Defendant. 

On Case 15CF243 
Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months on each case concurrent with each other days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges 
-- 94 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs to be determined ; due in $50 increments per month with case 15CM259 beginning 11-30-16 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
 

On Case 15CM529 Court Sentences Defendant to: 
--serve 6 months jail concurrent with 15CF243 with each other days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges 
-- 94 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs to be determined ; due in $50 increments per month with case 15CF243 beginning 11-30-16 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
 

Recess:2:22pm
Court's review of Defendant's letter received 9-14-2016  cc: Atty's
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 15CF243 & 15CM259 called together at pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #2 to Possession of THC, contrary to 961.41(3g)(e), a misdemeanor 

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2-15CF243 & Count #1-15CM259; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #
2-15CM259

On Count #2-15CF243 & Count #1-15CM259, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail, (Ct#2-15CF243) with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 4/15/16 by 9:00 am or 4.15.16 by 11:00 pm if approved by Sheriff
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
 as often as jail or Agent requests
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No contact with Haayden Seibel or any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay $125 drug testing fees (Count #2-15CF243) ($50 joint and several with Haayden Seibel)
--To pay $486 statutory costs
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 1:32 pm
Jury trial on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 11:00am [mo]
Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with attorney Karl E Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Huebner indicates that this case is to be part of a plea resolution with a Branch IV case.
The Court relinquishes jurisdiction of this case, only to allow resolution of this case this Friday. If Branch IV is unwilling to take jurisdiction of this case or if the plea does not proceed as intended, case is to return to Branch III

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court schedules this case for FSSC and Jury Trial, these hearings can be removed upon entrance of plea on Friday.

The Court distributes its scheduling order.
recess: 11:07am

NEXT: (1)FSSC on 6/13/16 at 1:00pm (2)Jury Trial on 6/16/16 at 8:30am

Cases 15CF243, 15CF245 and 15CM259 called together at 1:09pm [mo]
Co-Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with attorney Karl Huebner.  
Co- Defendant Haayden C. Seibel in court with Attorney David Zarwell
ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock verifies victim rights on all cases

As to Case 15CF243:
Mr. Bauer waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

As to Case 15CF245:
Mr. Seibel waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

A Joint Request for Subsitution is filed; the Court approves the Substitution
ADA Shock files an Information in cases 15CF243 and 15CF245

recess in cases 15CF243 and 15CF245 at 1:16pm; Atty. Zarwell and Mr. Seibel exit the courtroom

As to Case 15CM259:
Atty. Huebner requests a status conference
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 1:20pm

NEXT: As to Case 15CM259: Status Conference on 4/5/16 at 10:30am
NEXT: As to Cases 15CF243 and 245: Judicial Assignment and schedule for Arraignment

Cases 15CM259, 15CF243 and 15CF245 called together at 9:50am [mo]
Co-Defendant Haayden C. Seibel in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   
Co-Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with Attorney Karl Huebner 
ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Zarwell requests a Preliminary Hearing be scheduled out 3 weeks
--Atty. Huebner agrees
--No Objection from ADA Teuber

The Court notes that 15CM259 will follow as a Status on the scheduled Preliminary Hearing date. 
recess: 9:58am

NEXT: As to All Cases: Preliminary Hearing/Status Conference on 1/12/16 at 1:00pm

]MK] cases #15CF243 & 15CF245, and case #15CM259 called at 2:37pm. 
Co-Defendant/Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. 
Co-Defendant Haayden C. Seibel in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  
DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The State and both Mr. Bauer and Mr. Seibel waives Preliminary Hearing time limits in cases #15CF243 & #15CF245.
Attorney Huebner affirms the "not guilty pleas" and waives speedy trial in case #15CM259.
recess 
2:42pm. 

NEXT:   (1)  Pretrial Conference on 10/14/15 at 9:20am as to Mr. Bauer and at 9:40 as to Mr. Seibel  (2) Status Conference on 11/24/15 at 9:30am on all three cases

[MK] cases #15CF243 & 15CF245, and case #15CM259 called at 2:17pm. 
Co-Defendant/Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. 
Co-Defendant Haayden C. Seibel in court (PD counsel is being appointed for Mr. Seibel, however no PD counsel is available to appear with Mr. Seibel today). 
DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to all three cases: 
--Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the felony charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Both defendants verify that the dates of birth listed on the Complaints are correct. Mr. Bauer indicates that the address listed is correct, however Mr. Seibel provides a new address in Watertown) 
--the Court finds probable cause to exist in the Complaints 
--the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance in all three cases. 

As to Co-Defendant Bauer in Case #15CF243, Attorney Huebner indicates that the Defense is waiving Preliminary Hearing time limits. 
As to Case #15CM259:  pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial is waived. 

The Court requires a $2500 Signature Bond in each case as to each Defendant , with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia 
--to take any prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no contact with the other Co-Defendant 

Additional conditions of Bond in case #15CF243 and #15CM259: 
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking in case #15CM259
recess 2:29pm 

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance on all three cases on 9/22/15 at 2;00pm.
